title: Holby City spoilers: Cameron is haunted by ghosts at Halloween
text:
Never a welcome sight for Jac (Picture: BBC)

There are more spooky goings-on in tonight’s Holby City – and it’s not just because it’s (almost) Halloween. Cameron (Nic Jackman) is haunted by his actions when Evan died, and on top of the stress of having just come from the crematorium, he’s not in a good place. Then the Grim Reaper arrives on the ward…

Meanwhile, Jac (Rosie Marcel) is also haunted by memories of Joseph and by the constant worry that Emma would rather be living with Jonny and Stacey. Then Stacey (Emily Bowker) arrives and drops a bombshell and Jac’s world begins to crumble. Here are all the spoilers to look out for.

1. Serena (Catherine Russell) is concerned when Cameron insists on going straight to work after his mother’s cremation. He assures her that he’s fine, but he starts thinking he can see Evan everywhere he turns.

2. Jac is furious when Bea (Rosalind Halstead) returns to Darwin because the heart valve repair that Kian (Ramin Karimloo) performed has failed. Then she begins to suspect that Kian and Bea have a more than professional relationship. There’s a showdown between Jac and Kian – who’ll win?

Well this looks relaxing (Picture: BBC)

3. Dominic (David Ames) is trying to be involved with Helen (Verity Marshall) and Lofty (Lee Mead)’s baby, but his efforts don’t impress Lofty. Can their relationship survive the pressure of the impending arrival?

4. Kian seems to have fallen head over heels for Bea – but is he letting his feelings cloud his judgement as Jac believes?

5. Stacey visits Jac to give her some news – and Jac doesn’t react well. With her mental state crumbling, she tries to pretend to Sacha (Bob Barrett) that nothing’s wrong and also pushes Fletch (Alex Walkinshaw) away – but is she right to be concerned? Is Stacey really trying to take her child from her?

And this looks awkward (Picture: BBC)

6. Preparations are underway for the hospital’s 150 year anniversary celebrations and Fletch is worried about giving a speech. He asks Ric Griffin (Hugh Quarshie) – recovering from his brain surgery on Keller – for advice.

7. A Halloween-themed patient helps Cameron open up about his mum, but when the patient starts to deteriorate could Cameron, in his distracted state, have missed something important?

Sue Haasler is the author of five novels and the official BBC Holby City book, which you can read about here.
